articles.description: Former Barcelona forward Bojan Krkic believes that it is only a matter of time before his old team-mate Xavi ends up as head coach of the club, stating his belief that the Blaugrana are “destined” to welcome the Catalan icon back to Camp Nou.

articles.title: Fortnite XP Coin Locations: Where To Collect Five XP Coins For Week 9 Midas' Mission Challenge - GameSpot
articles.description: Here are some tips on where to find XP Coins to complete one of Week 9's Midas' Mission challenges.
articles.content: Week 9's challenges are now live in Fortnite. This week introduces the first set of Midas' Mission challenges, some of which fittingly revolve around gold. One asks you to search Midas' golden llama, while another asks you to find five XP Coins. This is easie… [+2260 chars]

articles.description: A bit of clever googling by trolling teens is making for some uncomfortable Zoom calls.
articles.content: Last week saw the U.S. Senate join the ever-growing chorus of federal officials advising staff against using Zoom, with one top official calling the video software a privacy and security concern. And while there are myriad reasons to be concerned about the vi… [+7310 chars]

articles.title: Valorant release date: Is Valorant coming to PS4 and Xbox One? - update from Riot Games - Express
articles.description: THE Valorant closed beta is now live and gamers on other platforms, including PS4 and Xbox One, are asking whether they can expect a version in the future.

articles.title: iPhone SE now available and starts from £10 a month (despite its iPhone 11 Pro features!) - Express
articles.description: APPLE announced its all-new iPhone SE earlier this week. Now the smartphone is available to pre-order, we've got a better idea about the types of deals available on the latest iPhone and you can pick up the new iPhone SE for a surprisingly reasonable £10 a mo…

articles.title: UK's largest oxygen supplier asks vets and rugby clubs to return gas for NHS - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: BOC, the UK's largest oxygen supplier, has asked non-essential customers to return their tanks of oxygen to help NHS shortages
articles.content:
Across the country, small businesses say that their oxygen supplies have been requisitioned by BOC in an effort to plug potential supply gaps.
Cross Keys RFC, a rugby union club in Wales, said it had returned all of its oxygen supplies, as did a dentist in F… [+1566 chars]
